profile.name: Dr. Nguimeya Tematio Gaël-Pacôme
profile.title: PhD in Computational Condensed Matter and Materials Physics
profile.bio: I am a researcher in Computational Condensed Matter and Materials Physics. My work focuses on understanding topological quantum phases in materials using Density Functional Theory (DFT) and Tight-Binding (TB) models. I study how materials with special quantum properties behave, aiming to uncover new insights into their fundamental nature. I am also deeply interested in Quantum Computing and Quantum Machine Learning because of their potential in materials science. These tools can help us study and predict new materials and their properties in ways that go beyond classical methods. I am particularly focused on developing quantum algorithms that solve difficult problems more efficiently, using quantum computers to model complex quantum phenomena, and exploring quantum machine learning techniques that may outperform traditional approaches in analyzing and predicting complex data.
